workflow.name: Shopify Orders to D365 Business Central Sales Orders / Sales Invoices
workflow.description:
## Workflow Information üìå

### Purpose üéØ
The intention of this workflow is to integrate New Shopify Orders into MS Dynamics Business Central:

- **Point-of-Sale (POS):** POS orders will be created in Business Central as Sales Invoices given no fulfillment is expected.
- **Web Orders:** This type of orders will be created as Business Central Sales Orders.

### How to use it üöÄ
1. Edit the "D365 BC Environment Settings" node with your own account values (Company Id, Tenanant Id, Tax & Discount Items).
2. Go to the "Shopify" node and edit the connection with your environment. More help [here](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/shopify/).
3. Go to the "Lookup Customers" node to edit the Business Central connection details with your environment settings.
4. Set the required filters on the "Shopify Order Filter" node.
5. Edit the "Schedule Trigger" node with the required frequency.

### Useful Workflow Links üìö
1. [Step-by-step Guide/ Integro Cloud Solutions](https://z0v4z2m6gixudcjglfbe.guidejar.xyz/categories/business-central)
2. [Business Central REST API Documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/business-central/dev-itpro/api-reference/v2.0/)
3. [Video Demo](https://www.loom.com/share/9e218cd53cf14a93bcb55d7b3d47ec45?sid=5fdfb8ab-8205-468a-b514-67193abac455)


### Need Help?
Contact me at:
‚úâÔ∏ègreg.lopez@integrocloudsolutions.com
üì• https://www.linkedin.com/in/greg-lopez-08b5071b/

workflow.name: [n8n] - Shopify Orders to D365 Business Central Sales Orders / Sales Invoices

parameters.content:
## Shopify Line Locations
For multi-location Shopify accounts, these group of nodes get the active location id for each order line.

## Get Shopify Orders
1.- Get Shopify Orders created/updated since one day prior. The Flow will get every order created or updated on the last 24 hours.

2.- Filter to get paid orders.

## Existing Customer Lookup (Business Central)
Lookup for existing customer in Business Central based on the logic defined in the URI, if a customer exist then that id is used, otherwhise a new customer will be created

## Workflow Information üìå

### Purpose üéØ
The intention of this workflow is to integrate New Shopify Orders into MS Dynamics Business Central:

- **Point-of-Sale (POS):** POS orders will be created in Business Central as Sales Invoices given no fulfillment is expected.
- **Web Orders:** This type of orders will be created as Business Central Sales Orders.

### How to use it üöÄ
1. Edit the "D365 BC Environment Settings" node with your own account values (Company Id, Tenanant Id, Tax & Discount Items).
2. Go to the "Shopify" node and edit the connection with your environment. More help [here](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/shopify/).
3. Go to the "Lookup Customers" node to edit the Business Central connection details with your environment settings.
4. Set the required filters on the "Shopify Order Filter" node.
5. Edit the "Schedule Trigger" node with the required frequency.

### Useful Workflow Links üìö
1. [Step-by-step Guide/ Integro Cloud Solutions](https://z0v4z2m6gixudcjglfbe.guidejar.xyz/categories/business-central)
2. [Business Central REST API Documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/business-central/dev-itpro/api-reference/v2.0/)
3. [Video Demo](https://www.loom.com/share/9e218cd53cf14a93bcb55d7b3d47ec45?sid=5fdfb8ab-8205-468a-b514-67193abac455)


### Need Help?
Contact me at:
‚úâÔ∏ègreg.lopez@integrocloudsolutions.com
üì• https://www.linkedin.com/in/greg-lopez-08b5071b/

## Existing Order Lookup (Business Central)

1.- This logic will avoid duplication of Business Central Sales Orders/Sales Invoices validating if an order with the same external Id exist already.

2.- If a match is found then the order is ignored

3.- The source of the order is evaluated, if the order was placed on the Point-of-Sale a Sales Invoice is created else a Sales Order will be created.

## Sales Order Creation

1.- Map on the "Sales Order Mapping" node any requiered fields to be integrated into Business Central.

2- The HTTP Node will perform a POST call to Business Central REST API to create the Sales Order.

3. After the Sales Order gets created, all line items will be added into the Order. 

4. If there are any while creating line items, the Sales Order will be deleted.

## Configure Business Central Environment Variables
1.- Enter your BC tenantId,companyId, name.
2.- Set the SKU number for the Items to be used for Taxes and Discounts.

parameters.url: =https://api.businesscentral.dynamics.com/v2.0/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json["tenantId"] }}/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json["environmentName"] }}/api/v2.0/companies({{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json["companyId"] }})/customers?$filter=email eq '{{ $json.customer.email }}' and contains(email,'@')&$select=id,number,email

=https://api.businesscentral.dynamics.com/v2.0/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json["tenantId"] }}/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json["environmentName"] }}/api/v2.0/companies({{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json["companyId"] }})/customers

=https://api.businesscentral.dynamics.com/v2.0/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json.tenantId }}/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json.environmentName }}/api/v2.0/companies({{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json.companyId }})/salesOrders({{ $json.so_id }})/salesOrderLines

=https://api.businesscentral.dynamics.com/v2.0/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json.tenantId }}/Production/api/v2.0/companies({{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json.companyId }})/salesOrders({{ $json.so_id }})

=https://api.businesscentral.dynamics.com/v2.0/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json.tenantId }}/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json.environmentName }}/api/v2.0/companies({{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json.companyId }})/salesOrders

parameters.content:
## Sales Order Creation

1. Map on the "Sales Invoice Mapping" node any requiered fields to be integrated into Business Central.

2. The HTTP Node will perform a POST call to Business Central REST API to create the Sales Invoice.

3. After the Sales Invoice gets created, all line items will be added into the Invoice. 

4. If there are any while creating line items, the Sales Invoice will be deleted.

parameters.url: =https://api.businesscentral.dynamics.com/v2.0/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json.tenantId }}/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json.environmentName }}/api/v2.0/companies({{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json.companyId }})/salesInvoices({{ $json.so_id }})/salesInvoiceLines

=https://api.businesscentral.dynamics.com/v2.0/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json.tenantId }}/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json.environmentName }}/api/v2.0/companies({{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json.companyId }})/salesInvoices

=https://api.businesscentral.dynamics.com/v2.0/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json["tenantId"] }}/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json["environmentName"] }}/api/v2.0/companies({{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json["companyId"] }})/salesOrders?$filter=externalDocumentNumber eq '{{ $json.order.id.toString() }}'&$select=id,number,externalDocumentNumber

=https://api.businesscentral.dynamics.com/v2.0/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json["tenantId"] }}/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json["environmentName"] }}/api/v2.0/companies({{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json["companyId"] }})/salesInvoices?$filter=externalDocumentNumber eq '{{ $json.order.id.toString() }}'&$select=id,number,externalDocumentNumber

=https://api.businesscentral.dynamics.com/v2.0/{{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json.tenantId }}/Production/api/v2.0/companies({{ $('D365 BC Environment Settings').item.json.companyId }})/salesOrders({{ $json.so_id }})

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
